    • inspect: Inspecting data
    • subset_data: Subset data by time, row, or oxygen ranges
    • calc_rate: Manually select and calculate rates
    • calc_rate.int: Manual extraction of rates in intermittent-flow respirometry
    • auto_rate: Automatic detection of linear rates
    • auto_rate.int: Automatic extraction of rates in intermittent-flow respirometry
    • adjust_rate: Adjusting rates for background
    • select_rate: Exploring and filtering results
    • format_time: Convert date-time data to numeric time
    • convert_DO: Convert between units of dissolved oxygen

References

Source: vignettes/refs.Rmd
refs.Rmd

respR publication


respR has been peer reviewed and published. Please cite this paper if you use it in your work:
Â 

Harianto, J., Carey, N., & Byrne, M. respR - An R Package for the Manipulation and Analysis of Respirometry Data. Methods in Ecology and Evolution, 10(6), 912â€“920. doi: 10.1111/2041-210X.13162.

Â 
Â 
Â 

See also

These packages may also help you analyse respirometry data:

  • FishResp - Sergey Morozov
  • respfun - Nicholas Carey
  • respirometry - Matthew A. Birk
  • rMR - Tyler L. Moulton
  • segmented - Vito M. R. Muggeo

Be sure to check out the FishResp site, where the developers are releasing a variety of amazing free and open source tools for conducting respirometry experiments, including resources for building your own respirometry equipment at a fraction of the cost of commercial systems.
